content_scrubbed:
AP Stats - Really easy and enjoyable. The teacher is easygoing and tells us tons of funny stories. The only con is that I am literally the only junior, everyone else is a senior.

AP Lang - This class is pretty aids. We spent the first 3-4 weeks discussing our summer reading (Grapes of Wrath, and Desert Solitaire by Edward Abbey) and rhetoric in general. Don't ask me why we had summer reading for a Lang class. The next 3-4 weeks we spent reading The Awakening by Kate Chopin and basically just taking reading quizzes on the book and having class discussions. My teacher hates standardized tests I don't think we've  worked on anything that will actually be relevant for the AP test.

AP Gov - I have a great teacher for this class, who actually worked in the Oregon State government in the past. I'm not a humanities person and I really dislike the homework, especially the reading out of the textbook, but I enjoy my time in class for the most part.

AP Calc AB - I love math, so this is my favorite class, one of the few I actually enjoy doing homework for. Plus, the concepts so far have been really easy, which is nice.

AP Physics 1 - I love this class, but am somewhat worried about how my teacher is preparing us for the AP test. We spend one day in class learning how to do a specific type of problem (free-body diagrams for motion on an inclined plane, for example) and then a few days practicing that same type of problem until it becomes mindlessly easy - essentially, plug-and-chug. We don't really go in depth into the actual concepts, which worries me, especially considering how hard the test is for this class.

Overall, I'm glad I took this schedule. It[.] not too hard, but certainly a challenge!
